title: Dissatisfied
body:
I am Suffering recurring painful water infections I take every natural remedy to try prevent . In June I was prescribed
Antibiotics over the phone  after speaking to a gp who didn't give me a chance to explain just said il send send antibiotics .problem reoccured in Aug i was listened to by a very nice female gp . Another gp phone call antibiotics over the phone. Again it's reoccured, I'm reluctant to ring as it's near impossible to see a gp. Always a phone call. My problem is debilitating and painful yet I'm now reluctant to phone my gp. Service was excellent but since covid I feel I don't have  gp support just a phone call each time. I'm so  grateful to our gps and NHS, but I don't feel supported right now. This problem has put my life on hold. I feel I should be able to make a appointment on what I feel is a emergency but my gp doesn't. I'm a low gp user apart from this problem I hate going to a doctor, but when I need to see one. It's a phone call.

title: A very positive experience
body: I had a total hip replacement at Barlborough Treatment Centre. Throughout my entire stay I was treated with the utmost dignity and care and professionalism.  I was anxious and fearful at times but the staff at every stage and every level, with expertise, cheer and most importantly, time, reassured me. The surgery was trouble free, everything explained, questions answered  and my recovery has been wonderful. There were difficult moments of course, both as an in-patient and during early recovery. In hospital I will never forget the compassionate care and quiet skill of the nursing staff and physio team.  I have used the helpline from home for advice and again was carefully listened to and advised successfully. And finally the food was excellent. This was a very positive experience for me. Thank you Barlborough.

title: Absolutely the worst surgery I’ve ever been with
body: I really don’t like writing bad reviews but this place really is awful. I was waiting to receive a letter and I had to call three separate times before they sent it. When they finally did they had provided me with all the wrong information. Wrong phone number and wrong clinic that doesn’t do the procedure I need. I spent three days trying to call around and find out who I’m actually supposed to have the procedure with. Also they have their phone line set up so that you have to listen to 3 solid minutes of information before you get through To anyone. Which may be ok on the first try but after calling and being on hold for 10 minutes and trying again seems a bit ridiculous. Just everything about this place seems badly run.

title: Why is the Shenstone Practice continuing to be…
body: Having tried several times to make an appointment at the Shenstone practice it remains closed to villagers except if you want a flu jab. There seems no apparent reason why the practice remains closed yet open if you want a flu jab. Surely it would be better to open it to relive the strain of the Lichfield practice who are unable to cope with the strain and where appointment times are unacceptably long?

title: Outstanding Practice!!
body:
My family have used the Queens Road Partnership for over 35 years and we have always been shown an exceptional level of care and support during this time. In particular for my mother who is a regular user due to her health conditions. We always receive an incredibly timely, consistent response to our queries or concerns.  All staff from the Reception Team to the Practice Manager and then to the Doctors take the time taken to listen. Whether this maybe for a prescription request, for telephone advice or to request a home visit. The team go above and beyond to listen to and always keep my mothers needs at the centre of her care and treatment. This 
even with increased demands on the Practice during this unprecedented time, the team have been unwavering in their comprehensive support, compassion and professionalism. 


The Practice is an example of the NHS at its very best and as a family we are very appreciative of the care we receive. Thank you Queens Road Practice for all that you do for the local community!!!

title: Get an emergency appointment
body: To get a telephone appointment from GP, you have to contact from 8:29 to 8:45 after150 times what a tragedy. This circumstance they are going to close GP soon what a shame NHS

title: Not happy
body:
Nurses  Unhelpful, I requested several times  to have central heating turned off, makes allergies come on also make me unwell. After a mejor operation the last thing one needs is stress, 
They completely ignored the request. The only time they were really pleasant was when the doctors/surgeons were present.
On leaving I was given somebody else’s medication. It took two days to get the correct medication.
After five days, in a private hospital, I was glad to get out.

title: rude receptionist
body: the doctors and nurses are really good at the surgery but as for the receptionists, they are very rude when you call up.

title: Impossible to get an appointment
body: I haven't actually visited the surgery as it is seemingly impossible to get an appointment. They are only scheduling on the day appointments and by the time you finally get through on the phone the appointments are all gone. The receptionist staff are also incredibly rude and routinely hang up the phone. I understand that they are extremely busy but surely it makes sense to let patients schedule appointments in the future and not waste everyone's time calling every day just to be told there are no appointments.

title: Absolutely awful
body: My husband booked in for blood test this morning arrived at 8.02 pressed button was told to come in and sit down, only 3 people including him in reception, sat down 20 minutes later was told that he hadn’t turned up and they’d called him twice and couldn’t now do the blood test!!! Said he hadn’t booked in ! This is not the first time this has happened!!

title: fantastic practise
body: excellent staff very helpful and very professional couldnt of asked for anything better. The individual I seen was so helpful and very caring for my welfare felt very comfortable and left feeling very happy.

title: Terrible appointment system
body:
Getting an appointment appears like it has been made hard intentionally. Perhaps to reduce patients coming in?

You can only book an appointment on the day, and to make matters worse. You have to call up at either 9am or 2 pm, and the likelihood is that they will be booked up. I have no idea why I can not book an appointment in the future. Why do you only offer on the day appointments? Makes no sense. Appointments are intended for future visits.

Also, I really am unhappy about the intrusive question from the receptionist. They are not doctors which means they do not hold patient-doctor confidentially.

And this is not mentioning the lack of mental health services. One male GP was empathetic but had nothing to offer. This left me going to the hospital. I am sure the whole point of a GP surgery is to reduce the number of patients requiring hospital visitation. Know I understand why people bypass the GP and go straight to the hospital. What else can they do if their GP doesn't see them?

I think I will opt to be anonymous as I feel they would treat me negatively for posting a review.

title: Great Doctors and service from them!
body:
Great Doctors and service from them!
However they are somewhat let down by the Receptionists who appear to be not too well organised eg don't ring back after committing to do so and are also quite defensive/evasive and not always very helpful even when they do answer the surgery phone.

title: Outstanding
body:
The staff at harbour view have been over the last 6 months  and are an Outstanding team, Very efficient and professional, during this difficult time as a care home protecting our very vulnerable the Drs have been an enormous support and have gone beyond the call of duty , we have never had to wait for anyone to contact us or problems with medication being prescribed, 

my residents say they are so fortunate to have such amazing GPs and nurses and reception and management team.
so thank you from everyone at Meadowcroft care home as with you all we can offer the very best service to our residents

title: Hit and Miss
body:
On the whole the doctors are attentive, and professional and I have confidence in their diagnoses and treatment.

The reception services leave a lot to be desired. The staff are often rude, patronising and unhelpful and the appointment system is laughable.  There is a serious need for customer services training.

title: Very thorough
body: I rang about one issue during my 30 week pregnancy and due to the Doctors and Students effective questioning they were able to identify and assist with a number of ailments that I was silently dealing with during my pregnancy. Excellent care.

title: Blood test
body: My Daughter was extremely nervous about her blood test , the phlebotomist was brilliant with her and she made her feel at ease .

title: Excellent caring team
body: I have attended this medical centre since 1983. Over the years I have met many members of the team. I have always found the staff to be considerate, caring and professional. I am very impressed and grateful for the support I have received. I have always been welcomed with a smile and a commitment to sort out every issue. I could not have a better team supporting me. Thank you.

title: Great service, safe environment, lovely staff
body:
Visited the practice this week for an appointment with a doctor for ear infection after having telephone triage in the first instance.  
Very impressed with the surgery's set up, clear instructions, one-way system, greeted by kind receptionists.
Am happy to return to surgery next week for appointment with nurse for following up review, very reassuring.

title: Secretaries
body: 23 aug 20 i had a medical examination at maidstone,nurses were there doctors were there all was excellent then went for a virtual bowel scan at penbury hos, all was good staff were all there very nice caring people doing there jobs in these covid times ,i was told it would be 5 days for my results,so im worried and waiting for post every day that was 2 weeks ago,so i start to ring hospital phone is answered by staff very helpfull then they put me through to the doctors secretary who is in an office no contact with staff or patients and get a recorded message becouse of covid she is not there, unbelievable????

title: poor practice
body: I saw a GP for mental health concerns today. My prescription and sick note was sent to a closed pharmacy and I was told I had to wait another 2 hours before I could collect this. The reception staff were extremely rude and unhelpful informing me they were simply 'messengers'. Appalling practice when a patient is extremely struggling.

title: Slow to get appointment, quick when had it
body: I wish I had been able to get an appointment earlier, I had to wait two weeks. But once I had it the doctor was very helpful and it was useful being able to do it all online.

title: at 98 wanted ear syringe but turned away
body:
Disappointed, that's for sure.
Recently had blood test and waited over two weeks for result. Finally an email to say my GP phoned and as I am at home it was somehow missed, but no repeat!!? Have difficulty using phone so email is better.

title: Disorganised
body: Filled out an online form to see or speak to a doctor. Was called by a  physiotherapist who then saw me and couldn’t help said I would get a call from my doctor within the week. 2 weeks later I had to phone to say I had not been called. Eventually had a call from a doctor.  I didn’t know I had been moved to a different doctor who I didn’t know so no history known of my problem. Felt rushed when seeing the doctor. Now awaiting further investigation.

title: Great doctors IF you can get an appointment
body: I have phoned 3 times in a week after receiving a letter to book the flu vaccs for my daughter. Each time on hold for more than 40 minutes before giving up. I would try the online but the letter says very clearly to phone, but there literally is no point. In the past I had quite a complex hip injury which they dealt with fabulously but it just isn’t worth the pain of trying to get an appointment with their undoubtedly excellent doctors and we are now looking to move practice. I feel like there’s a couple of things over the years that I would have had checked out if I could have got an appointment. I wonder how many people are wandering around with more complex medical needs now than they would have had if they had been able to be seen and it’s a bit of a scary thought.

title: Terrible service
body:
Didn't listen to what I said. I got told I would be contacted by someone. I called back one month later, left a voicemail, and no-one responded. Called back the following month and got told that an email got sent and my case was closed. The email I received told me to check my account on their website for the letter which was never updated with a document.
Furthermore during the process they asked my GP to forward documents I never had for conditions I was never diagnosed with.
Rather than resend the letters they are telling me I have to reapply to start the process again. Why waste my time with that if they care so little about their patients.

readBy.name: Barnet, Enfield and Haringey Mental Health NHS Trust x

title: Best practice!
body: I have been with Church Street Practice since we moved to the area. I have nothing but words of thanks for the whole team. From receptionists to doctors me and my family have had a team we can trust and rely on. Health is a serious matter and we are extremely happy with the way they have always treated us. I have had need of them in these exceptional times and they have been there with the usual professionalism. Thanks so much for the hard work!

title: Bad practice
body: Had a blood test which came back needing treatment had doctor give ring back which couldn't talk as was working found it very hard to discuss  my problem in front of clients but had to take it as this was the only thing offered to me a long and drawn out way of trying to find out what's wrong with u and still not seen a doctor or got to the bottom of my problem rubbish system would have been a lot quicker  and less time with phone calls if I had seen a doctor seems  that the doctors don't want to see anyone and just want to use phone u cannot carry out a full consultation on the phone they r missing important things out this needs to be looked at .a very bad way of dealing with patients

title: wonderful nurse - childhood immunsiation
body: My 3-year-old daughter had an appointment booked for routine immunisations. As you can imagine she was a little apprehensive. However, the nurse with her calm demeanour placed my daughter at ease. Immunisations were carried out without any tears and she was given a butterfly 'bravery certificate' which made my daughter's day! Thank you for making the whole experience a positive one.

title: Responded quickly to my need
body: Completed online consultation online and was called by a paramedic and then a doctor both were able to ease my anxiety and come up with a plan to be able to help me.

title: Worst practice
body:
Sorry to say but this is a very badly managed practice with poor leadership and total loss of purpose they are there for. 
Virtually impossible to get through. 
When you do very rude staff who seem frustrated with having to talk to patients. 
Can’t get an appointment for days with only one option for making an appointment. 
They really need to look at their ways of working from the patients view and serve them the surgery is there to provide a service and should do this in a way that adds value to the end user based on their requirements and not on the limitations the surgery has. If there are constraints stopping you from being able to serve to meet the requirements of your patients then change the way you work.

title: Helpful people
body: Like many surgeries the system set up to book appointments is unhelpful but I met a fantastic receptionist who went over and above to help and a great nurse who rang.

title: Friendly staff and Doctors
body: Very caring, but hard to get an appointment now.. Talking to a doctors on the phone doesn't always help..

title: Excellent Service
body:
I have had need for two online consultations. In the first instance I was offered an appointment with a nurse who helped me with the breathing problem, then offered a Doctors appointment within 24 hours who prescribed antibiotics and referred me to cardiac, who organised an electrocardiogram within a week and a cardiac phone consultation a week after that. 
An excellent and professional service. The speed of phone response could be faster, but you get there in the end. Prescriptions are sent to the chemists as quickly as pre Covid conditions

title: Rude Receptionists
body: This doctors surgery is the worst I have ever been to. The receptionists are not just rude but unneccessarily rude and unhelpful. There is no call queuing system so end up hitting redial, redial, redial until eventually get through.  Sometimes I have haf to hit redial over 100 times just to get through to speak to someone! Would not recommend this medical centre at all to anyone!!

title: Very good medical care.
body: Actually getting a consultation with a Medical Practitioner is very difficult. It took me over an hour whilst I queued on the phone to speak to someone. When I finally got through the receptionist was helpful, and reassuring. The GP phoned me 2 days later and said it was appropriate to be seen, rather than a phone consultation. I am sure an econsult would not have brought this outcome. My GP cannot be faulted and I am very happy with any treatment. Whilst I understand that the current Corona Virus has an effect on the running of the Practice, I feel the initial contact system is not well organised. It is frustrating to say the least.

title: Awful telephone service
body: Whilst suffering an asthma attack my husband tried to contact the drs he gave up after 20 mins and bundled me into the car when we got there the surgery was empty receptionist's stood talking to each other and still made us wait whilst I was gasping for air then when I saw the nurse she said well you should of called an ambulance . The drs ,I have never had a problem with always helpful and made you feel at ease.

title: Overstretched practice
body: My experience of on line GP request has been excellent. However, when things are not an emergency needing an ambulance but you need to be seen urgently, as my husband experienced, the systems were frustratingly ineffective.  He did get a call back the same day but it was an anxious time and we were not reassured. Staff seem to be working very hard but are maybe hindered by a poor patient record system.

title: good practice
body:
under the circumstances, they are running the practice the best way they know how....all staff need to keep themselves safe too, not just the patients.
Getting an appointment prior to covid wasn't very easy then either, since becoming beacon medical group it's got much harder.
When you do get an appointment the staff and Dr's are brilliant.

title: Professional and kind service
body: Thank you for your kind and professional help today. Everyone was excellent. Thank you to mammographer Sarah who went above and beyond.

title: Not so good,as it was.
body: Difficult now days to book appointment.  Up to 40 minutes on the phone. If you request to speak to a certain Doctor, when you have been told by the receptionist, they are in surgery that day.  Them you get a call from someone else. Then they pass the message back to the reception. And so on. I think alot of the problem is due the increase in population  in Ivybridge.  We need a new medical centre.  With better parking.

title: Thank you for good care for my aunt
body: Over the past few weeks the care my sick great aunt received has been very good. thank you to the doctors who handled the process well. the doctor was prompt in providing the death certificate and also was kind enough to send a condolence card. this small gesture was much appreciated. thank you

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

title: Blood testing service phone line
body:
52 people in queue waited for 1 hour and 20 minutes for the phone to be answered. This was second attempt tried to phone yesterday and was cut off after 50 minutes.
  Please sort this problem out ASAP

title: Very Poor Practice
body: I have asked for my medical records and been told the practice will not provide them. Also when contacting the practice the minimum waiting time I have experienced is 10 minutes. A specialist Doctor from MRI contacted the surgery on my behalf and was on hold for 40min. I have raised concerns about waiting times to the office manager only to be told they are dealing with this. That is not the case. The administration at the this doctors is very disappointing. Also over a 4 month period we brought our son to the practice with eczema that was not clearing . Due to the lack of support from the practice he ended up being referred to the local children's. We came from an area were you could get an appointment on the day, could always speak to a receptionist, and got a referral when it was required.

title: Rubbish website & phone system
body:
Tried today to find out about flu jabs. Spent 10 minutes on the phone trying to listen to a poor quality barely audible voice message and then being blasted by full volume repetitive music. Decided to try the online website and found the link to Flu, followed that and got to a link that promised me the facility of booking a flu jab
Pressed the flu jab link to be told that Beechcroft Surgery was not using the online system. Who what or where is the Beechcroft Surgery. No other links to follow. Then tried the online leave a message service, spent 5 minutes answering a stream of non relevant questions and got nowhere. Went to the Carisbrooke centre and got nowhere there either.
Complete and utter waste of time.

title: wonderful staff
body: attended a @e with bad tummy and bad nerves the treatment and staff are second to none left feeling much much better thank you so  so much

readBy.name: East Kent Hospitals University NHS Foundation Trust

title: BLOOD TEST
body: Had a blood test this morning. Lady was very professional, friendly and efficient.  Made the whole experience a lot better than it could otherwise be. And, of course, a lot easier than going all the way to Kingston Hospital. Well done and thank you !

title: Poor service
body: I rang to get an appointment for a blood test, I waited 31 minutes before the call was answered, when I complained about the length of time,no apology was offered and I was deliberately cut off before I could make the appointment.

title: Very rude abrupt
body:
My mom was told to sit back in waiting area A and E after having an ECG following a fall when the doctor realised he asked why she had been sat out in waiting room when her ECG was showing something g dangerous the sister on A E started shouting back at the doctor the doctor was about my mom.  Nurses complaint out loud about this ha I front of patients who are clearly already distressed. Staff don’t want to make eye contact as they can’t be bothered if you ask a question communication extremely bad between patients and staff.
AMU generally ok as has good nurses in the bay looking after mom but they are over run under staffed and this shows very clearly in the attitude displayed 
ALL Doctors extremely good they just can’t get the support from arrogant nurses and CSWS in order to give best care.
Ward 15 staff are mostly very rude if you telephone they speak to you I. A very arrogant way my mom was very distressed during her stay on ward 15 there was a language barrier and she was in considerable pain but could not get help to sit up while I was on phone to mom on her mobile I heard a nurse speak very rudely to my mom what a shame she’s an elderly patient got mom home as soon as possible.
I have had very good care at this hospital but I think if you are elderly and can’t stick up for yourself you will get some problems with the rude abrupt staff 
It’s always the nurses and CSW STAFF that are rude 
Porters, doctors X-ray staff have always been very kind and gone out of their way.
It’s very difficult to leave your elderly loved ones in the care of some of the staff who spoil it for the rest.

title: Good practice
body: I'd just like to say what a very good practice they are the receptionists will do their best to find the right appointment for you and are very understanding,if you can't see your own Dr then they will find another Dr who can see/ring over the phone at a time that suits you .you are a great team of people thankyou for support

title: Telephone response pathetic
body: Every time, I need to phone the Medical Centre to either make appointments for my 92 year old father or progress chase his medical care, it is ALWAYS extremely difficult to get to speak to Reception. It can take up to 20 attempts, because the line is constantly engaged. It is so frustrating and such a poor patient experience.

title: Friendly and Responsive
body: I was 17 in a queue, which is a little higher than normal. When I got through to the receptionist, she was friendly calm and responsive. She sorted out an appointment I had been asked to make whist maintaining a friendly but professional approach. Considering the pressure she was under she was brilliant. I don’t think I could have coped as well as she did. 10/10 and * * * * *

title: Awful practice ran by awful receptionists and…
body:
In terms of the care I have recovered by the medical staff (nurses, midwives and doctors) this practice has been good. 

But when I want to try and get an appointment I am unable to unless I'm willing to spill chapter and verse of my issue to the receptionist. Once I had a lump on my lip so I explained the issue to the receptionist who must have studied medicine as she the proceeded to diagnose me with a cold sore... I explained this wasn't the case and that it was a lump and finally got an appointment, the GP was helpful and referred for me to have the lump removed... definitely not a cold sore. 

More recently I have had a baby, during the height of the pandemic. For each review and each set of immunisations I have not been seen on time, a new mom worried about being out with my baby then being forced to sit and wait around for up to 25 minutes after my alloted time. 

And then this week, I need a repeat prescription, I rang and the receptionist said she could just request no need to speak to the doctor.. I told her the doctor said before extending my prescription they would need to do a telephone consultation, the receptionist assured me that wasnt the case and my prescription would be ready by Thursday..  Friday I attended ... No prescription available as I need to speak to the Dr, the receptionist didn't ring a inform me and get me an appointment, just left me to find out for myself. She then booked me a telephone appointment, and were currently 5 minutes late over the 2 hour window I was given. 

Dreadful service with a practice manager who hides away and doesn't take calls so I can try and out my views across. Thankfully I'm a young lady who is more than capable of ensuring she's heard, but there are people out there who don't and i want change for those people.

title: bad service
body:
i was told a dr would ring me in 2 weeks time -this did not happen- after 17 phone calls i was connected to the surgery-to be offered a telephone conversation with my  dr in 18////days time.
 i do understand the receptionists are under a lot off pressure .
WHEN // i do see or speak to a doctor they are very good,

title: Outstanding care and service
body: On visiting the GP today he was already running late but due to the patience of his  listening and sympathetic treatment of all my symptoms he was even later once finished with me!                     His level of  care and listening skills were outstanding-nothing was dismissed or considered irrelevant. He was kind and considerate throughout and thoroughly professional-a real asset to the practice. Thankyou.

title: Great Service
body: Used online service. Easy to use .Received a phone call and offered appointment to see a gp on the same day. Went to Highlands at the end of the day .. reception and GP seen v polite professional and friendly . Premises all clean and covid prcedures easy to follow.

title: Not the best!
body:
Having usually had a fab service from Hazeldene, I was very annoyed at the mixed messages being received. I understand the changes that have been made to the surgery due to Covid and how work is now being done but to be told one thing over the phone and via the website e.g how to order a prescription and then being told abruptly by reception that this is not a done thing and have them attempt to close the door On me is not fair.  Only came to get a login for patient access as was told on the phone and via the website this was needed for me to be able to see and schedule appointments as getting through by phone is difficult at the moment.
I think that the website needs updating so not to cause confusion or abruptly spoken receptionists ( who have possibly repeated this 100s of times to different patients)
Come on Hazeldene let’s go back to being fab instead of getting not so happy reviews. ( Could not find a complaints tab on the website sorry! )

title: Some staff need more training
body:
I attended out patients clinic 1 on the 3rd september.
On arrival was spoken to very politely by receptionist.
When it was my turned to be called a gentleman health care assistant Shouted my Surname out and said the words come on.
I respect other people and would not use just a surname to any one.
I had noticed he did this to another lady also. 
He was so disrespectful 
The team at outpatient 1 are normally all very polite and helpful

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Leicester NHS Trust

title: First class practice
body: Caring Doctors and professional staff who even under the extreme pressures of Lockdown conveyed nothing but patience and courtesy which was so reassuring over the phone. My wife and I have  been registered with this surgery since 1965 seeing many changes over the years but always the same professional care throughout. From our personal experience this is a Surgery we would recommend to all.

title: Excellent Service
body: Had the pleasure today of having to liaise with GP surgery, what a great practice this is, if only others followed suit!!! From Terence NHS Professional

title: Great department
body: The two gents (can't write names) who run the orthotics for children at north manchester in the side room are brilliant, my son loves going to get his new orthotic insoles and boots and they always make him feel really welcome. Would recommend their services to anyone needing orthotics.

title: Rude receptionists, good doctors
body: The reception staff is extremely rude. The doctors are ok they always listen to you but is hard to reach them becouse of the receptionists. I think is very rude to ask me personal questions for the reason I am calling for an appointment. They shouldn't be free to ask you why you are calling and ask for details. They should also say their name before so you know with whom you speak. They never do so.

title: Terrible service
body: I was dealing or attempting to my mothers illness. It was impossible to talk to a doctor despite me telling the receptionist that it was serious. Despite asking for a doctors appointment at 8am I was phoned ( after reminding them ) by a nurse at 5pm she took details and sent a medical practitioner the 3pm next day he prescribed inappropriate medicines.  I phoned the surgery the doctor wouldn’t talk to me. I only have my own surgery at Chelmsford for comparison Oakland’s scores zero

title: Good service
body:
Had to have a regular appointment for an annual check , used econsult,had call back and appointment made 
Also had to make econsult about a knee issue , again very good , doctor called back and X-ray booked 
Very efficient

title: Very happy until now
body: Trued to get an appointment to see nurse last Fri to nothing available told to call back Mon tould the same  got call back to say can fit you in Fri  430 turned up to be tould appointment was 1230  one member of staff said nurs on last appointment could not see me another member to me nurse left 20 mints ago all to have 2 sutures removed  not had any problems before usual very happy

title: Excellent Dr
body: I have been incredibly impressed with the quality and standard of care I recently received from one of the Doctors who could not have been more helpful.

title: Supportive and helpful
body: Extremely supportive and helpful receptionist. Phone consultation really concise and enabled me to continue at work rather than get time off to visit surgery. I’ve always had very positive experiences at this surgery thanks to the professionalism of all staff.

title: 40 mins and no answer
body: Waited on the phone for 40 minutes and still no answer. 40 minutes is too long to her through to someone to just book an appointment!

title: Outstanding care
body: Compassionate staff providing expert care. Picu staff and all involved from play team to cleaner are warm, professional and world class. Brompton saved our daughters life we are forever grateful.  Well done team Brompton.

readBy.name: Royal Brompton and Harefield NHS Foundation Trust

title: Difficult to contact
body: Have been trying to contact the practice on behalf on my wife who is in need of a knee replacement. Impossible to speak to anyone, let alone make and appointment with a doctor.

title: Telephone appointment
body: Promptly after I had sent the online questionnaire, I received a call from my doctor. We discussed my symptoms and he recommended further treatment. Very satisfactory.

title: Econsult extremely effective
body: I have used e consult on 2 occasions and had a phone call that day from doctor plus a follow up visit .

title: Supportive department
body: Had to be admitted to treehouse when my newborn son had an infection. I am so grateful for the care and attention he received, the consultants have ensured that thorough investigations took place and the nurses have provided exemplary care throughout even working with Covid restrictions.

title: Helpful and efficient
body: Phone in morning had call back within 20 mins. Due to covid you can't go in but I was listened too and GP sent prescription straight to chemist. Then received text to say it was done. Told to call back if any problems.  NEVER had any problems great practice.

title: Amazing GP
body:
Nothing has ever been too much trouble. I have been contacted during covid with video links and telephone calls.l have been dealt with with the upmost care and dignity.I cannot praise them enough.I have been able to deal with my illness a lot more easily knowing that I have the support from all at the surgery.
This is by far the best gp surgery that I've ever been with and although covid has prevented face to face consultations , I feel that I've been offered the best alternatives. Kindness and genuine concerns ..Thank you so much

title: Disappointed and frustrated.
body:
My daughter was booked in for a blood test today (which took two days to get through to reception to actually book the test), but the full blood test could it be done as the Practice had "run out" of the correct type of tubes needed for certain parts of the test. 
When I enquired what would happen now, I was told that a note would be left for the doctor and that we might have to book in for another blood test at a later date. 
I am frustrated that I will have to spend hours waiting on the phone to speak to someone to book another appointment, and also that it will be a further delay in terms of time to identify my daughters illness.
Why does the Practice not have the correct/sufficient equipment and resources?
Is this a case of government under funding, or local mismanagement?
Very frustrated and disappointed!

title: Outstanding continued support
body:
I have been part of the Whalebridge Practise since I was a small child, I’m now 46, seen the Surgery relocate twice and many different doctors come, go and retire. Like many of us I’ve had many issues over the years, some serious some not so, but have always felt supported and listened to.

One doctor in particular (and I’ve told him personally face to face) that his care and genuine approach is the one and main reason I stay with the Practice. (As I moved out the area many decades ago) ... 

I’ve had to visit the surgery 3 times since the coronavirus pandemic, never had an issue getting an appointment and have always been able to see/speak to this doctor.

So credit where credit is due! They’ve worked all the way through the pandemic and been there for us come rain or shine. I for one am eternally grateful for my care and also that of my family over the years, especially that of my father who is sadly no longer with us. Your phone call the morning after he passed away meant a lot to the whole family :) 

Thankyou

title: Friendly and helpful
body: My wife and I just returned to the UK for good after staying abroad for almost 20 years.  We applied for registration of GP here, and are very impressed by the friendly and eagerness to assist attitude.  We both believe this is the most warm surgery we have ever met.  Thumbs up up up!!!

title: Waiting times. Lack of transparency.
body: I was referred to a consultant and got a quick appointment. The consultant I was given operated on someone I know which Is good as he was highly recommended. I was put on the waiting list for THR in Mar 2019. A few weeks later I went to the Hip/Knee school to learn about the recovery procedures. Everyone was told the waiting list for surgery for THR was 18 weeks. Covid 19 came about Mar 2020 and as of Sept 2020 I am still waiting. It appears that the 18 weeks comes from the government guidelines. Unfortunately it was not 18 weeks. Such a shame as I am a great advocate of the NHS.

title: Excellent practice
body: My dad was so sick in January and the GP was so kind to us they booked us an appointment for him. Whilst the appointment his condition got worse so the GP was so helpful they called us an ambulance and were so nice with us! They even called a day later to ask how was my dad doing and guided us with advice. Such a professional service every time i call to book appointments or even advice they urge to help. Not once have they been rude or disrespectful. Always the kindest. Thank you Doctor’s House!

title: Not user friendly
body: The previous on line booking for appointments was very useful so please reinstate. Phoning the surgery is a frustrating as you can't get through. E consulting is a positive addition but should be additional to making an appointment to see a dr. U should be able to phone nurse direct for taking blood etc. Video consultation should be encouraged providing it is secure and easy to use.

title: Great staff but finding them is really hard.
body:
Had appointment at the RBH physiotherapy dept regarding a neurological complaint. 

Website site plan only provides extremely broad outline of hospital and has complete inability to zoom in to buildings to give more detailed and useful information, as a result we had only a rough idea of where to go on the day.

Attended hospital, the main information desk to direct patients was closed. On site maps as little use as the on line plan. Got to the appropriate block by following signs but once in general area the signs were simply inadequate. (ie no signs at all for the specific department we needed.)

Returned to entrance of hospital and eventually just stopped a man wearing an NHS ID lanyard at random. He was extremely helpful and escorted us to the correct location. Stating himself en-route that the signage was not very helpful. 

The staff in the unit were very good and our experience regarding care / treatment was fine. However it would have been very easy for us to have spent a long time wandering around trying to find the unit and to have missed or delayed the appointment unnecessarily.

Is it not possible to improve your on line plan to allow patients to obtain far more information and failing that to take a long hard look at the poor signage in the corridors?

title: Outstanding Practice
body: Richmond Surgery is not just outstanding because of my last visit, but because of EVERY visit, regardless of how trivial or complex the reason is. You will be treated with respect, consideration and in a most professional manner by ALL of the surgery staff. So thank you.

title: Difficult Covid Times
body: I have a long term medical complaint, Gp cannot treat me without a Covid test. Will need to wait 48 hours to 5 days for results. Told to ring 111 or 999 if i am not happy. GP saying only following government guideline !! To this GP the government do not stop you treating patients.

title: Unable to see gp
body:
Have trapped nerve to L4&5 waiting surgery, seen NO gp through the whole horrible experience, just prescribed controlled drugs over the phone, had to ask for referral, as our private insurance has been suspended,
Drugs run out all different times, constantly doing online requests, which adds to the whole trauma. 
But the lack of being able to talk to someone is shocking, eg: my husband rang, 5 mins waiting, then got into the car, phone still ringing, arrived @ health centre 11 mins later, still no answer, went to door, wouldn't let him in & just said a Dr would ring me, my  morphine was making me sick, so needed a I sickness drug,  a hr later gp rang, & suggested I halfed my dose?!! (in pain here) so then subscribed appropriately. But it's all hassle every time without fail....

title: Badly under-resourced
body:
I had a blood test on August 20th.
I heard nothing for the following 12 days so phoned on Tuesday 1st Sept. I was told that the results were in and the nurse would phone me about them on Friday. When I asked why so long I was told 'it was the first available slot'. Anxious wait.
Today (Friday) I phoned at 11.00 and was told that the nurse would ring me that afternoon. I asked for a bit more precision and was told probably about 1.30.
At 3.00 I phoned again and was told that due to another nurse being ill an afternoon session had been arranged but that the nurse was working to six o'clock and would definitely be phoning. On both occasions I asked that the nurse be told that I had phoned.
Nothing. A whole day wasted in worry. A depressing, distressing experience.
Looking at the other comments on this site reinforces the opinion I have held for some time that they simply don't have the staff resources to cope with demand.

title: Very caring
body: I’ve been with this practice for a long time and recently had some health issues including surgery during the pandemic. The doctors have been great. Very helpful, caring and always able to get an appointment

title: Best Care Ive Received
body: I joined the practice a while ago when moving to the area. Every doctor and staff member I have dealt with is excellent. My care and follow up checks have been second to none in terms of timing and following through. Theres never a delay or issue with getting in touch with anyone and their manner is consistent at every visit. I am very lucky and greatful to have moved to such a wonderful practice and highly recommend it for praise.

title: Doctors are fab
body: When you get to see one they are great  I don’t like having to jump through hoops to get there not a lover of e consult not every other query is that simple. Don’t like the fact call it is answered then she says we are busy and cuts you off when you phone. Fab treatment when you actually see a doctor

title: Very impressed
body: This is the best GP I’ve ever been registered with, and I have moved around a few. The receptionists are really efficient, kind and knowledgable and all the doctors and nurses have been professional and attentive.

title: bad practice
body:
This GP 
most be the worst in norwich the doctors dosent know what the are doing the nurses are not sure of what they are doing the keep making mistakes on important medical issues
The reception staff are too hard and horriable to patients 
Duty of care are not taking serious in this practice

title: Best Possible Hospital Experience
body:
My three year old son badly cut his hand with a piece of thick glass on a Sunday in August 2020. Within hours I was being seen by an A&E doctor. He took photos of my son's hand and spoke at length with one of your colleagues at Queen Victoria, regarding the best treatment for him.

My son was offered an appointment to see a plastic surgeon at Queen Victoria two days later.

From the moment I walked in, I was taken aback by the friendly staff and their approachable and professional manner.

The nurse ran through what would happen that day, so I knew what to expect. I also spoke to the anthesitist and surgeon, so I could discuss my conerns surrounding the surgery.

The nurses continued to keep me informed, even letting me know where my son was on the surgery list. Thankfully he was first up and we were walked into the theatre. The surgical team attempted to insert a cannula, which wouldn't go in. Instead of persisting (which has happened previously at a different hospital), the staff did not hesitate to change tac and go to plan b. I was very grateful for this, as my son remained calm.

I was notified as soon as the surgery had finished and again walked down by a nurse to see my son. 

I was given a debrief by the recovery unit and I also received a debrief later on by the surgeon.

On leaving, my son was delighted to receive a jigsaw.

Upon reflection, my son had a calm, pain free operation and we were both treated wonderfully by the staff. It was an anxious time, as a mother, but by the staff keeping me continually informed throughout our visit, it really helped me cope with the whole experience.

I can honestly say that this has been the best hospital experience I have ever had and this hospital should be a model for all others. Fingers crossed we won't need to visit again though.

I would like to thank all the staff at the hospital, your hard work is appreciated and valued.

readBy.name: Queen Victoria Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great practice, but...
body: I initially contacted this practice as I'm not registered with a GP and  currently staying with family close to St Neots, my home address in North London. Feeling unwell during the summer last year I visited their walk in practice, for the first time on Thursday evening, 8th August 2019. The receptionists were lovely, one taking my initial call before I left home, the other giving me directions and advice on where I could park my car.  I completed the necessary forms and didn't have to wait long, before being seen by a GP, who was wonderful. He listened patiently, asked pertinent questions, had a gentle manner, was sympathetic, kind and caring. The second time I visited the surgery was on Sunday morning, 5th July 2020. The receptionist came to the door and explained the process to follow, because of Covid 19. She was patient, kind, told me to ring the surgery, photograph my infection, send it through to an e-mail address she would text to my phone and wait for a call. The nurse rang within a short period of time and was absolutely wonderful. She sympathised, asked pertinent questions, was caring, kind and again thorough during the telephone consultation. Unfortunately it was 3rd time 'unlucky on 4th September 2020.' I had suffered an insect bite, possibly one from a spider last weekend and it had continued to get worse during the week. My Mum is a nurse in Belfast and I sent her a picture and said how I was feeling. Not one to allow us to ever have a day off work and only go to the GP if necessary she told me to go and see about it asap. I had also gone to a pharmacy the previous evening, showed my bite and he said it may be infected and should visit my GP. (also patient and kind). Tonight when I contacted the surgery about 6.15pm, the receptionist was lovely. I gave her details over the phone and she said a nurse would phone and ended the call saying to take care. The nurse rang after 7pm and the lack of 'bedside manner' is putting it mildly. The tone of her voice implied she would tell me my symptoms, rather than listening and accepting, me explaining to her what my actual symptoms were. Her response was she wouldn't normally give an antibiotic (I hadn't asked for antibiotics) and as a minimum she expected bites to be monitored for a week. As I received the bite possibly last Sunday, exception 24 hours it would be a week and there hadn't been any improvement. I explained my symptoms again and she said they were normal for insect bites. As I am prone to being bitten and having had reactions to bites throughout my life, I would recognise the difference on what is normal and what is an infection. At no time did she request a photograph which may have been pertinent to a thorough diagnosis. Whilst I respect and admire all of our NHS workers, during this difficult time, its disappointing to receive such a service, when kindness can effect positive change during this pandemic. This nurse needs to reflect if she was the patient and had this treatment.

title: Rude Reception Manager
body: I called On a Friday afternoon because I was extremely worried about some results I had received wanting to speak to a Doctor and was told I would Have to wait til Monday and that the doctors were not available to help me when I perused this I was told it was too late. A bit of reassurance would have been helpful at a very worrying time.

title: Bad service good GPS
body: Very poor reception staff make it very hard to get an appointment. Ive tried for to get a specific time to receive a phone appointment for three days as I work most hours only to be told thats not possible. All I needed was to review my prescription when I explained I could not always answer my phone as I'm at work to reception staff they were very rude and defensive and refused to give me an advanced or timed appointment or to even speak to a doctor despite the fact by prescription was running out. Out of desperation I phoned 111, 30 minutes later I was phoned by my GP who sorted my prescription and was great. To be told I could not speak to a GP for three days and then to phone 111 and hear from a GP in 30 minutes is very frustrating. You would think you are phoning a call centre the way you are treated not a community health centre its not on.

title: Exceptional patient care and support
body:
Yesterday I needed to speak with my GP following a second unexpected bereavement in as many years. The receptionists were as always helpful and accompanying and I was able to have a telephone consultation with my GP the same day. In the current climate I find this amazing and an incredible commitment to the patient.
My GP arranged an appointment for me as the issue could not be examined in a telephone call and he was so understanding, kind and supportive. He offered me time and reassurance whilst including me in the decision making around my care. Instead of being given a holding response or told to come back in six months I was given full support and a plan was implemented to address the concerns I had discussed with him.
I think the measure of an exceptional practitioner is one who, whilst having the clinical knowledge and expertise, administers is in a humanistic, attentive, calm and empathic manner. My GP has these attributes and I came away feeling like I had received exceptional and bespoke care and support.
Throughout COVID the staff at Mansfield Medical Centre haven't faltered in continuing to deliver the same high quality services that we patients have come to appreciate and enjoy. 
I take my hat off to them and thank my lucky stars I have such a fabulous practice!

title: Great practice
body: very happy with the gp clinic aslo they very good wen u have any promble .and they sort it out threw the phone very helpful in all aspects very happy with gp etc

title: Was amazing and the best
body:
I know there is Covid but...
I have been a patient at Canbury for several decades. It was always an amazing supportive service. The doctors cared. Now it seems distant uncaring and run by locums who really just want get through the day. The amazing relationship which felt like a real family practice has gone.

title: Friendly, happy atmosphere
body: I had a colonoscopy at the Hanover unit, Leigh yesterday. The staff were so kind, I was put at ease straight away. Everything about the procedure was explained to me. My privacy and dignity were respected. The staff were brilliant! Thank you all.

readBy.name: Wrightington, Wigan and Leigh NHS Trust

title: Brilliant service
body:
Professional friendly staff, theatre,  consultant,  anthestist kept me fully informed, made my surgery painless and comfortable. 
Great coffee too
Thank you all for looking after me.
